Package es.ulpgc.eii.spool.crawler.strategy

Interface CrawlerStrategy<T extends Event>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of Event produced by this strategy
All Known Subinterfaces:
PullCrawlerStrategy<T>, StreamCrawlerStrategy<T>, WebhookCrawlerStrategy<R,T>
public interface CrawlerStrategy<T extends Event>
Root abstraction for all event crawling strategies in the spool-crawler framework.

A CrawlerStrategy encapsulates the full ingestion pipeline for a given transport and delivery model. All concrete strategies — Pull, Stream, and Webhook — extend this interface, ensuring that the consumer always interacts with events through a uniform crawl() method regardless of the underlying source.

The three built-in strategies cover the most common ingestion patterns:

  • PullCrawlerStrategy — on-demand polling (REST API, JDBC, file)
  • StreamCrawlerStrategy — continuous push stream (Kafka, WebSocket)
  • WebhookCrawlerStrategy — external HTTP push notifications

Example — consuming events independently of the strategy implementation:


 CrawlerStrategy<ParkingEvent> strategy = buildStrategy(); // pull, stream or webhook

 strategy.crawl().forEach(event -> process(event));
Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
  • PullCrawlerStrategy
  • StreamCrawlerStrategy
  • WebhookCrawlerStrategy

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Stream<T>
    crawl()
    Collects and returns all events currently available from the source.

  • Method Details

    • crawl

      Stream<T> crawl()
      Collects and returns all events currently available from the source.

      The semantics of "currently available" depend on the strategy:

      • Pull — fetches and deserializes fresh data from the source on each call.
      • Stream — drains the internal EventBuffer accumulated since the last call to crawl().
      • Webhook — drains the internal EventBuffer populated by incoming receive() calls.

      The returned stream is sequential and consumed only once. Calling crawl() again will return a new stream with any subsequently available events.

      Returns:
      a non-null Stream of typed events; may be empty
